name: ecce homo 2021*
description:
It's Friday the 13th of August, 2021. Wildfires rage on the horizon of our socially distanced world. Analog riders on the circuit board of the digital universe, we enter haltingly into a reality forever changed by Covid-19. Christ is above. He is masked against the Delta variant, sorely wounded, and bone tired. This time his crown of thorns is from the vile hatred, foul lies, and obscene greed of some who call themselves Christian. It begs the question, doesn't it: WWJD? 
Copyright 2021 Elwood 308. Digital art based on the paintings and views of the late Woody Castrodale. More at woodycastrodale.com.
*"Ecce Homo" ("Behold Man") are words allegedly uttered by Pontius Pilate to a cheering crowd who gathered to watch as a burdened Christ stumbled by, going to his death on the Cross. A painting titled "Ecce Homo" was first made by Hieronymus Bosch in the 1470s. There have been others.
